channel.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
channel.description: Whatever I do it stays at 4 : 3, and never switches to 16 : 9. Here's a video I made demonstrating the problem: [url='https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=5vReSPD4fOU']link[/url]. So does anyone know of this?

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: 1Lister_of_Smeg
item.description:
Out of range means you are asking for a resolution your monitor does not support.

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: flypig
item.description:
Foulard:

Anybody with a little bit of skillz know the name of the file i should open with my bloc-note ?

I had the same problem, and although I couldn’t find the configuration file, it looks like there might be an alternative solution.

If you right click on the game in your Steam game list, select “Properties”, then click “Set Launch Options…”

Then enter something along the following lines as your launch options:

-w 1024 -h 768

This will set the width and height of your display (you should choose something you know works with your monitor). You can also add -window if you want it to start in windowed mode (and there’s a whole list of options here in case it’s useful: https://developer.valvesoftware.com/wiki/Command_Line_Options )

This should get things up and running. Once you’re in-game you can change the video settings to something appropriate, and remove these launch options.

I hope this helps. I found it worked for me, so I hope you also have success with it.

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: PlausibleSarge
item.description:
right click the game in steam

Properties->Launch Options

type -w 640 -h 480

remember to remove it from the launch options after you exit or it will set it back to 640x480 next time you play

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: jonmarck
item.description:
I switched the resolution of Black Mesa to 1600x1200 only to find my video card can’t render that… AND THERE’S NO WAY TO SWITCH IT BACK. Why isn’t there an option to boot in a safe resolution!!!

I’ve tried reinstalling 3 times but never does the resolution revert back to the default setting.

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: silentkit
item.description:
Lysergic:

I was having the same problem, set your resolution to a widescreen format then restart and change the aspect ratio 16:9 and it should work

https://upload.wikimedia.org/wikipedia/commons/f/f0/Vector_Video_Standards4.svg here’s an image that shows “widescreen resolutions”.

Yeah, I set my resolution to the highest one, and now widescreen works.

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Alx
item.description:
How exactly do I run BM again? There’s nothing in the Start Menu or my desktop so where is it? How do I start it again?

Restart Steam and you should see “Black Mesa” in your game list, if it’s not already there.

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Kiingy
item.description:
[COLOR=‘PaleGreen’]
In the steam client, click on the Library tab, it will be in your games list on the left.

Also, you can change the resolution in Black Mesa, you need to set the right aspect ratio first.


16:9 is the one you’d need for 1600x900.

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: breadwinner
item.description:
Right, I installed BM and when it was done it had a checked box next to “Run Black Mesa” or whatever. So I did, and I fixed up the graphical options until I realized I couldn’t get to my screen resolution, which was 1600x900. No problem! Exit out and go into the Source SDK 2007 launch options and blah blah. So I run Source SDK 2007 but this time it’s starting up… Lost Coast?

How exactly do I run BM again? There’s nothing in the Start Menu or my desktop so where is it? How do I start it again?

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Dr_Karamazov
item.description:
This is such an odd question. Why ask such a question when you can just try it yourself? Putting in the wrong settings will not cause your monitor to explode and send shards of burning plastic into your face…it just wont work.

What next? Questions about what happens if you press the letter ‘A’ on your keyboard?

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: cman2k
item.description:
exact resolution is limited by your monitor as well as your video card. I’d say with that card you can probably run the game at whatever highest resolution your monitor supports.

Read full topic

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: Katana
item.description:
I have a widescreen monitor, and the game works fine for me. There is an option in the menus that picks between the different ratios; you sure you’ve got that selected as 16:9 or 16:10, depending on your monitor?

Proper monitor scaling is built right into the engine, so if you have issues, I would almost imagine you would have the same problems with Team Fortress 2.

Read full topic

If you mean what detail level you can run the game on, I’d say all maximum settings. I play on my laptop since I haven’t gotten around to rebuilding my desktop, and it runs on all maximum settings at 1366x768 on an Nvidia GeForce GT540M.

item.title: Aspect Ratio: all about it!
item.dc:creator: silentkit
item.description:
Hi all,

So when I go to change the video settings, all my graphics settings apply, but no matter what I do the game still stays in 4: 3, with black bars on the side and all. I try switching to widescreen, but it never does anything and just goes back to 4: 3. Anyone else have this problem?

Read full topic
